meanings.definition: A person who votes in an election.
meanings.sent1: The votarist eagerly went to the polling station to cast their vote.
meanings.sent2: Every citizen should strive to be a responsible votarist during elections.
meanings.sent3: The votarist proudly wore their 'I Voted' sticker all day.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of opinions, the votarist's vote is like a beacon of democracy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the votarist standing in line to vote will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To cast a vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: Remember to votarist for the candidate you believe in.
meanings.sent2: Citizens have the right to votarist for their preferred candidate.
meanings.sent3: I will votarist as soon as the polling station opens.
meanings.sent4: The power to votarist is a fundamental aspect of democracy.
meanings.sent5: She will votarist with conviction and pride in her choice.

meanings.definition: A supporter of a particular candidate or party.
meanings.sent1: As a loyal votarist, he always stands by his chosen candidate.
meanings.sent2: The votarist campaigned tirelessly for their party in the election.
meanings.sent3: The votarist's enthusiasm for their candidate was infectious.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the ultimate votarist of her political party.
meanings.sent5: The votarist's unwavering loyalty to their party was truly admirable.
